isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Engine Symptoms Diagnostics - Test Procedures - Water In Fuel (WIF)

entry.para: Corrosion on connector, sensor, or cover plate assembly

item.para: Clean drain pan, flat with a wide opening

step1.para: Determine if the WIF lamp is on. If the lamp is on, the fuel is probably contaminated with water.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, comply with the following:

item.para: Read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
Dispose of fuel according to local regulations in a correct container clearly marked DIESEL FUEL.
Keep away from open flames and sparks.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, comply with the following:

item.para: Do not mix gasoline, gasohol, or alcohol with diesel fuel. This practice creates a fire hazard and is potentially explosive.

Do not allow engine fluids to stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails with soap and water, or a good hand cleaner. Wash or properly dispose of clothing or rags containing engine fluids. Engine fluids contain elements that may be unhealthy for skin and could cause cancer.

note.para: Engine fluids, oil, fuel, and coolant, are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or other bodies of water.

step1.para: Put a clean flat drain pan under the HFCM drain plug
Wipe down the frame around and under the drain plug or the HFCM and drain plug.

calloutgroup.callout1: Area to be wiped down before draining

figure.caption: Drain plug remove and hanging from stem

step1.para: Loosen and remove the drain plug from the threads and hang it from the stem. Drain HFCM to the clean flat drain pan.

note.para: Flow out of the drain should be as steady a stream as possible. When running down the side of the frame with the plug fully removed, or just running down the plug while it is hanging, use your best judgement if it is a steady flow. An unsteady flow could indicate fuel system problems.

step1.para: Check the O-ring on the drain plug. The drain plug will have to be removed to replace the O-ring. Install and hand tighten the drain plug.
Check the fuel in the drain pan for contamination. Dispose of the contents in the drain pan properly in accordance with local requirements.

item.para: Excessive water or contaminants may indicate that the tank and fuel system need to be flushed and cleaned.
Some sediment and water may be present if the fuel filter has not been replaced for a prolonged period of time, or if the sediment and water have not been drained recently.
The fuel should be clear, not cloudy. Cloudy fuel indicates that the fuel is not a suitable grade for cold temperatures.
The fuel should not be dyed red or blue, these colors indicate off-highway fuel.

The fuel should not indicate evidence of waxing or gelling. Waxing or gelling in some fuels in cold weather could clog fuel filters and the fuel pump and cause restrictions in the fuel or low fuel pressure.

step1.para: Turn the ignition switch to ON, determine if the WIF lamp is off.

item.para: If the WIF lamp is off, the procedure is complete, do not continue.
If the WIF lamp is still on, continue with step 8.

step1.para: Redo steps 4, 5, and 6. Turn the ignition switch to ON to start the HFCM fuel pump, determine if the WIF lamp is off.

item.para: If the WIF lamp is off, the procedure is complete, do not continue.
If the WIF lamp is still on, continue with step 9.

note.para: If the WIF indicator stays on after the water has been drained, the WIF sensor, the WIF sensor connector, or the cover plate assembly may be corroded, the condition should be corrected and retested.

step1.para:
Check the WIF sensor connector, do " WIF (Water In Fuel) Sensor " in " Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics
" section of this manual.
Remove the HFCM to service the WIF sensor or check for corrosion on the cover plate assembly.
Install the HFCM, and redo steps 4, 5, and 6. Turn the ignition switch to ON to start the HFCM fuel pump, determine if the WIF lamp is off.

item.para: If the WIF lamp is off, the procedure is complete, do not continue.
If the WIF lamp is still on, replace the HFCM.
